intro: Hieracium paucilingua, commonly known as the few-linged hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium paucilingua is often found in the northern United States and southern Canada.
